title: Are the Yamaha HS80M monitors good for hip-hop and electronic music? Like are they good for mixing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just hit an 808 kick on HS80M. You feel nothing. Add a sub woofer and check it. There will be a drastic change. HS80M is an all rounder for any type of music making. They are also good for mixing too. You should have a reference on bass translation in your mix. Don’t mix with your “gears”, mix with your “ears”.

For mixing, and in their price range, they compete well with 8" monitors from JBL, KRK, etc. Depends on the sound you like (and who you ask). But if you don't have a subwoofer, a hip-hop or EDM track will not sound like it does in the club. You can still mix on these, as long as you have a good reference as to what pro tracks sound like on these speakers.
